attributes.action: Stop the ban on tethering birds of prey
attributes.additional_details:
If the ban on tethering birds of prey is allowed it will affect training birds of prey especially goshawks and Eagles and
lead to 85% -100% of all falconry centres in Britain especially those in the North to close down plus the practice of tethering birds of prey as part of there training and management has be done since the beaker period and on that basis falconry and austringer should be protected under unesco as part of our cultural heritage.
attributes.background: Stop defra's proposed ban on tethering birds or have birds of prey except from the new rules.
